text:
{{ theme|pprint }}

I would also test this also to see if it grabbing this

I agree this is confusing. A buyer will probably assume a theme is a theme and expect everything listed in the marketplace to work.

Maybe the text should say,
"This theme uses advanced features that require HubSpot CMS Pro/enterprise, etc."
Hi <@UQWGKUEN7> give this try and see if it gets you close.

Ahhh I know i can get it from a coded template but I was referring to just making it happen from the UI in the page editor. 

I feel like it should be easier for a content editor to make.

Yes <@UG7S8J18D>. And now I've to invest more time to get a non-CTA version of my themes approved over the marketplace.

They could have stopped customers on Starter plan from creating CTA rather than limiting them from installing the theme itself.

I just hope they drop this limitation soon!
Hello all :wave: Any of you have a recommendation of a theme where you learned a lot to create your own themes, templates (specifically landing page templates**), etc.?

If you’re meaning a theme to get inspiration from to learn how to improve how you build sites: Highly recommend looking through the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes/HubSpot-cms-boilerplate|HubSpot boilerplate>
Yes, of course - I studied this one a lot. I should’ve mentioned, I’m looking more into “landing page” design/templates
